titles: By the Council of State, a proclamation whereas by an act of the last Parliament intituled An act for dissolving the Parliament begun the third of November 1640 ... persons engaged in the late rebellion in Ireland, and all who profess the popish religion, and all ... who have assisted ... in any war against the Parliament ... shall be incapable to be elected to serve as members in the next Parliament ...
author: England and Wales. Council of State.
publisher: Printed by Abel Roper and Tho. Collins, Printers to the Council of State,
notes: Title from caption and first words of text.
"Wednesday March 28. 1660. By the Council of State at VVhitehal. Ordered, That this Proclamation by forthwith Printed and Published. W. Jessop, Clerk of the Council."
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
